content.description: Stand start with a pair of shallow pocket-edges. From there, work up and slight right through edges and pockets to reach a solid mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is uneven but pads well.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Strappado.

content.description: Sit start with hands on the jug arete. From there, pop up to right hand two-finger pocket, slap the left hand up to a sidepull, then work up the remaining lip, throw a heel over, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. Immediate landing is great, but there is a rock directly behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Strappado.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand on an edge at the arete and a left hand gaston on the face. From there, work up along the arete on the edges. At the 3/4 mark, reach the good jugs and the subsequent lip for an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good but slightly uneven.
content.location: It climbs the southeast arete of Strappado.

content.description:
Hand, toe, heel, hand...repeat...All Along The Diphthong traverses an undercut lip on quality stone over a very good landing.

Sit start or squat start (I could do the sit with a cheater pad, but I couldn't reach it otherwise) with hands on a pair of pinches and place a right heel. From there, traverse left along the sloping lip until the apex, then crank onto the slab, and top it out.
content.protection: At least a few pads. The problem covers a lot of ground, but the landing is pretty good. There is a rock behind where the problem climbs, but it never presented an issue.
content.location: It climbs the east lip of Strappado.
